I don't mean to complain, but I felt I had to correct you on one point here, regarding the first movie and fullscreen vs widescreen. Fullscreen is actually the original aspect ratio, the widescreen version is made by cutting away the top and bottom parts of the image. Usually it is the other way around, but not this time.
To confirm this I downloaded your version, and compared it to my own DVD. Take a look at this image, showing the exact same scene, my version to the left, your to the right:
http://img88.echo.cx/img88/3249/fsvsws8un.jpg
Note the hands. I can give you more examples if you want, but I think it is pretty obvious from this image alone.
I really appreciate your effort, but please change the description to not spread incorrect information about the different versions available.

Great movies just a word of advice for those wanting to play the trilogy on stand alone DVDs.

"Audio: English, 128 VBR Stereo @ 48K Hz"

means the 90% of todays hardware will suffer from audio slips (if played at all).Therefore be ready to  Google your way to audio renormalization. My personal choice is VirtualDubMod but there is lots of good tutorials for other tools.

Just invest the time and effort to doit, is worthy.
